description: 1. 0000 Mohammad Ayaz Niazi, the imam of Wazir Akbar Khan Mosque in Kabul, was killed along with another worshiper after a planted bomb exploded inside the mosque yesterday evening. 2. 0340 Afghan Public Health Ministry registered 758 new cases of Covid-19 in the past 24 hour, bringing the number of confirmed cases to 17,267, among which 294 people have so far...
text:
A. News headlines.

B. Home news:

1\. 0000 Mohammad Ayaz Niazi, the imam of Wazir Akbar Khan Mosque in Kabul,
was killed along with another worshiper after a planted bomb exploded inside
the mosque yesterday evening. Some religious scholars and Afghan citizens
condemned the terrorist attack, urging Afghan government to punish
perpetrators of the incident. Local officials say two individuals have been
detained in connection with the incident. Video shows some individuals and a
security official speaking.

2\. 0340 Afghan Public Health Ministry registered 758 new cases of Covid-19 in
the past 24 hour, bringing the number of confirmed cases to 17,267, among
which 294 people have so far died and 1,522 recovered. Kunduz police chief,
Abdul Rashid Bashir, and district governor of Qala-e Zal district of the
northern province, Fahim Qarloq, are also among those died after contracting
the virus. Video shows a public health official, Wahid Majroh, and some
physicians talking.

3\. 0550 A government source, who requested anonymity, says negotiations
between the Afghans are likely to take place in less than two weeks, adding
that the meeting will be held online due to the outbreak of Covid-19. The
State Ministry for Peace Affairs says discussions are underway on specifying
the date and place for holding the intra-Afghan dialogue. Some analysts say
the intra-Afghan dialogue will not start in the near future. Video shows an
official of the ministry, Najia Anwari, and some analysts speaking.

C. 0830 Commercial break.

4\. 1200 Speaker of the lower house of parliament, Mir Rahman Rahmani,
expresses concern over high absence of MPs in the parliament. Video shows
Rahmani and some MPs talking.

5\. 1500 Local officials in northern Kunduz province say the graph of imports
and exports at the provincial Shir Khan border port has decreased by 25% due
to the outbreak of Covid-19. Video shows an official and some traders
speaking. (See separate MR)

D. 1840 Foreign news.

E. 2100 Sports.

2500 End of news bulletin.

Source: Arzu (Arezo) TV, Mazar-e Sharif, in Dari 1400gmt 03 Jun 20

org: The State Ministry for Peace Affairs
companies: The State Ministry for Peace Affairs

title: Programme summary of Afghan Arzu TV news in Dari 1400 gmt 3 Jun 20
html:
A. News headlines.

B. Home news:

1. 0000 Mohammad Ayaz Niazi, the imam of Wazir Akbar Khan Mosque in Kabul, was killed along with another worshiper after a planted bomb exploded inside the mosque yesterday evening. Some religious scholars and Afghan citizens condemned the terrorist attack, urging Afghan government to punish perpetrators of the incident. Local officials say two individuals have been detained in connection with the incident. Video shows some individuals and a security official speaking.

2. 0340 Afghan Public Health Ministry registered 758 new cases of Covid-19 in the past 24 hour, bringing the number of confirmed cases to 17,267, among which 294 people have so far died and 1,522 recovered. Kunduz police chief, Abdul Rashid Bashir, and district governor of Qala-e Zal district of the northern province, Fahim Qarloq, are also among those died after contracting the virus. Video shows a public health official, Wahid Majroh, and some physicians talking.

3. 0550 A government source, who requested anonymity, says negotiations between the Afghans are likely to take place in less than two weeks, adding that the meeting will be held online due to the outbreak of Covid-19. The State Ministry for Peace Affairs says discussions are underway on specifying the date and place for holding the intra-Afghan dialogue. Some analysts say the intra-Afghan dialogue will not start in the near future. Video shows an official of the ministry, Najia Anwari, and some analysts speaking.

C. 0830 Commercial break.

4. 1200 Speaker of the lower house of parliament, Mir Rahman Rahmani, expresses concern over high absence of MPs in the parliament. Video shows Rahmani and some MPs talking.

5. 1500 Local officials in northern Kunduz province say the graph of imports and exports at the provincial Shir Khan border port has decreased by 25% due to the outbreak of Covid-19. Video shows an official and some traders speaking. (See separate MR)

D. 1840 Foreign news.

E. 2100 Sports.

2500 End of news bulletin.

Source: Arzu (Arezo) TV, Mazar-e Sharif, in Dari 1400gmt 03 Jun 20
